subject: Medicine
title: Oral Medications
description: A micro-lesson that makes Oral Medications usable.

hook.text: You swallow a pill and feel better in 30 minutes. But that pill traveled through acid, intestines, and liver first.

buildup.text: Oral drugs dissolve in the stomach, absorb through the intestinal wall, and pass through the liver.

discovery.text: The liver metabolizes much of the drug before it reaches the bloodstreamâ€”called the first-pass effect.

twist.text: Some drugs are destroyed so heavily by the first-pass effect that they can't be given orally at all.

climax.text: That's why insulin is injectedâ€”stomach acid and the liver would destroy it before it ever worked.

punchline.text: Swallowing is simple. Absorbing is complicated.

quiz.question: What is the first-pass effect?
options: The liver metabolizes much of an oral drug before it reaches the bloodstream
The first dose of a drug always has the strongest effect
The drug passes through the brain before reaching the body
